nodes.text: Sorry. I'm just a little on edge. All these damn flies and no air conditioning. If I just had a little more power I'd be able to shake 'em... but I don't.
He said that, did he? Well, you tell him that the generator is uranium powered and that the miniscule amount of energy I require would barely register on the generator. And tell him I want my power!
I could scrape a little something together for you if you did it. I can't promise much, but then, it's not too huge a favor, either.
They come here because for some odd reason I exude fly nutrients. My body is rich with food for them, and this sweating just makes it worse.
Do you think you can help me with my fly problem? I'd be very grateful.

Francis the mutant has a power fist. He keeps betting it in arm-wrestling contests. The problem is being stronger than him. If you're interested, I can give you some pills that should give you the edge over him.
You're done with the generator? Thank you so, so much. I can't even begin to describe how grateful I am.

I'm Eric. I used to run the hotel in town, but I had to sell it because of my fly problem. I also ran the tavern, but had to get out of that, too, for the same reason. Finally, I used to run the generator, but flies kept getting into it.
Yes?

There's a power generating station downtown that controls the power to the city. If you could just go there and get permission to give me a little more energy for my air conditioning, I'd be grateful.
Close the door! Please! Go away and take those damn flies with you!
Then I'm doubly grateful. Oh... I hear you're looking for a GECK. Try asking around in NCR. It's to the south.
Like this town needed any more hard luck. Like *I* needed any more.
Here's all the money I have... $150. Thank you.
I've tried that. I've tried everything. The only thing that keeps the flies off me is not to sweat... and when I don't have enough power to keep cool, I can't.
I can't tell you how grateful I am to you. Please let me know as soon as you're done so I can turn up the air conditioning and take a bath.
Please don't wait too long for this... I'm getting really sick of all these flies.
Come in already! Close the door behind you! Don't let in the flies!
These pills are called buffouts. They'll increase your strength, but your mind will suffer for a little bit. Don't take too many or you might get hooked. Good luck with the fist!
Thanks ever so much for your compassion. That's sarcasm, by the way, in case you hadn't noticed. Get the hell out of my house.
The power generator's on your left as you come into Broken Hills from the outside world. It's run by a guy named Brian, a lazy son of a bitch who does as little work as possible.
Oh yes. The flies have lessened, the air is cool, and I'm less sweaty. Better deal for everyone all around!

links.text: Who are you?
How do you get the power?
You could try bathing, you know.
Why are the flies coming here?
Tough luck for you, pal. So long.
Will do! Nice speech!
I'll tell him. I have other questions.
Forget it. I don't want to do it.
You've got a deal. Just make sure to have something for me when I get your power for you.
Let me think about it.
That's just plain nasty. Why not take a bath or something?
I see. That's more than I needed to know. Goodbye.
Then I'll be doing you a favor by killing you.
How grateful?
No way in hell.
Sure thing.
Let me think about it.
I'd rather have cash, if you have it.
I don't want a reward.
Sure thing.
The common way to express thanks is through gifts of money or equipment.
Don't, then. I'm fine with your thanks.
I see. So long!
That's an awful lot of jobs. I have more questions.
Have you tried bathing?
It's much nicer in here. Comfy?
Where do the flies come from?
Nothing. Forget it.
Where's the power generator?
I talked to Brian and he said the power rations are so tight that he can't possibly allow you to increase your share.
Who are you?
Are you nuts? No way. Maybe you'll get so miserable you die. Do the world a favor.
Yeah, I'll do it for you.
I haven't got time. Maybe later.
How grateful? Cash or equipment?
D'okay!
Thanks! Bye!
No, thank you. So long.
I see. Goodbye.
I see. I have more questions.
Will do. So long.
Will do. I had some other questions.
Sure. I'll let you know.
Sure. I had some other questions.
All right, all right. No need to shout.
Dries? F-f-f!
I'll let in all the damn flies I want. Loser.
Thanks! So long!
So long, fly boy!
Why not go to hell and die?
I see. Well, that's all for now.
Sounds like a real piece of work. Thanks. I have more questions.
I'll say. Well, that's all. So long!
